creator: bmarcum@evoke.com
text:
The following xml segment:

    <property name="osfam" value="nada"/>
    <condition property="osfam" value="windows">
        <os family="windows"/>
    </condition>
    <condition property="osfam" value="mac">
        <os family="mac"/>
    </condition>
    <condition property="osfam" value="unix">
        <os family="unix"/>
    </condition>
    <condition property="osfam" value="dos">
        <os family="dos"/>
    </condition>

    <echo message="os = ${osfam}"/>

echos string 'nada'.

This code works correctly (reports 'dos') if I run with ant 1.4.1.

creator: conor@apache.org
text:
Actually the code does not work correctly in Ant 1.4.1 - it works correctly in
Ant 1.5.1. Properties are immutable - once set they cannot change. This policy
is there to allow command line overrides, etc. 

Some tasks did not repect this (i.e. condition, available, etc). This was
tightened up in 1.5. Sorry for the inconvenience.
